{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3322734,"name":null,"username":"Yuri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/yuri/{size}/218839_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T20:59:16.739Z","cooked":"

i am just wondering if it is possible to use a radio that isn’t the OM5P-AC to conect with the robot, maybe one with better range for tests. and if yes, how can i do it ?

if i’m not wrong, there was an off season somewere that they were testing a diffrent radio, so i imagine that the radio configuration utility can handle diffrent modems

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T20:59:16.739Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":86.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457079,"topic_slug":"is-it-possible-to-configure-a-diffrent-internet-modem-as-a-robot-radio","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I like making sparks with batteries"},"post_url":"/t/is-it-possible-to-configure-a-diffrent-internet-modem-as-a-robot-radio/457079/1","custom_user_title":"I like making sparks with batteries","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3322736,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T21:01:54.145Z","cooked":"

For a competition? No. It’s against the rules anyway.

For not a competition sure. That’s pretty simple as long as the DHCP is set-up correctly

but how can i configure the modem to work as a frc radio ? only plug it in at the radio configuration utility and burn the same config ?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T21:11:44.855Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457079,"topic_slug":"is-it-possible-to-configure-a-diffrent-internet-modem-as-a-robot-radio","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":25951,"username":"Technologyman00","name":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I like making sparks with batteries"},"post_url":"/t/is-it-possible-to-configure-a-diffrent-internet-modem-as-a-robot-radio/457079/3","custom_user_title":"I like making sparks with batteries","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3322774,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T21:36:21.854Z","cooked":"

The robot uses regular old Ethernet. If you are familiar how to set up network it is fairly easy.

You set the modem up as an access point. Use the correct subnet for your robot. Configure the dchp to stay out of the usual static addresses. Connect the drive station computer to the ssid you set. Using the config tool for the OP5 is not likely to work.

Im guessing it would work if you set the router’s IP address to 10.xx.yy.1 and enable dhcp in the published range. Have you tried this?
